Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2013 10:02PM AwaitingSunset wrote: I did a search for location of breast lymph nodes and the sentinel node is the area that I am having pain. I can feel a lump, but since it is painful I assumed that it would not be cancerous. That is mostly what I have heard about painful lumps in the breast. Sometimes, I can hardly think because it bothers me so much.

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2013 08:48AM AwaitingSunset wrote: I finally got the results of my mammogram and ultrasound.  The letter I received from the medical mall stated that the results of my mammogram and ultrasound were normal. and that I should follow up with my routine mammogram in 1 year.  I had my doctor send me a copy of the actual report that he received and it didn't seem as if everything was completely normal.  Also, the place that is bothering me underneath my arm is such that I can't put my arm down beside my side without great discomfort.  It feels as if there is a large marble sitting there.  Also, the place where I am having problems on my breast gets red and burns quite frequently.  I am not able to even wear a bra now. My ultrasound report stated that there is a 5 mm nodule consistent with lymph nodes would correspond to the mammographic abnormality.  There is also a benign appearing 1.4 x 1.7 x 0.6 mm lymph node.  The impression from the radiologist was that a decision for biopsy of any palpable masses will have to be based on clinical grounds.  Also stated that there is a subcentimeter nodule consistent with intramammary lymph node 3 o'clock left breast.   I am not worried about any of it being cancerous, I am just in so much discomfort that I would like to remove the whole area.
Posts.Title: Pain in left Sentinel Node AwaitingSunset AwaitingSunset

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2013 10:26PM AwaitingSunset wrote: Thank you all for your responses. I do not know that it is in the sentinel node, just in the area where I saw that the sentinel node is located. It is located on the left side of my breast close to the underarm, but not under the arm. I do have another lump that is underneath my arm in the area right above my armpit and a place that is painful on the left side where it feels like my ribs are. I guess I need to find a doctor to get it all checked out.
Posts.Title: Pain in left Sentinel Node AwaitingSunset AwaitingSunset

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2013 10:26AM AwaitingSunset wrote: Bessie, It was a BIRADs 2 finding.  My surgeon said he would see me in a year.  It is so frustrating when you can feel something there and it is so uncomfortable as well.  My surgeon did say that he felt a palpable lymph node in the area where I am having discomfort.  I just don't know where to go from here.
